channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Enhancing Temporal Action Localization: Advanced S6 Modeling with Recurrent Mechanism
item.description: Temporal Action Localization (TAL) is a critical task in video analysis, identifying precise start and end times of actions.

item.title: An Empirical Investigation Into the Time and Frequency Response Characteristics of Hopf Resonators
item.description: We present an empirical investigation of software developed by the Science and Music Research Group at the University of Glasgow.

item.title: GPSFormer: A Global Perception and Local Structure Fitting-based Transformer for Point Cloud Understanding
item.description: The core of GPSFormer is the Global Perception Module (GPM) and the Local Structure Fitting Convolution (LSFConv).

item.title: SA-DVAE: Improving Zero-Shot Skeleton-Based Action Recognition by Disentangled Variational Autoencoders
item.description: Existing zero-shot skeleton-based action recognition methods utilize projection networks to learn a shared latent space of skeleton features and semantic embeddings.

item.title: ANHALTEN: Cross-Lingual Transfer for German Token-Level Reference-Free Hallucination Detection
item.description: Research on token-level reference-free hallucination detection has predominantly focused on English, primarily due to the scarcity of robust datasets in other languages.

item.title: The Language of Infographics: Toward Understanding Conceptual Metaphor Use in Scientific Storytelling
item.description: Our classification of the visual conceptual mappings within scientific representations is based on the breakdown of visual components in existing scientific infographics.

item.title: Scikit-fingerprints: easy and efficient computation of molecular fingerprints in Python
item.description: In this work, we present \textit{scikit-fingerprints}, a Python package for computation of molecular fingerprints for applications in chemoinformatics.

item.title: Heart-Mind Harmony: Predicting Stress from Heart Rate
item.description: in the end, the findings of this research may additionally have broader implications for improving the satisfactory of existence and basic properly-being of individuals via permitting early pressure detection and intervention thru the analysis of heart price statistics.

item.title: Aligning Sight and Sound: Advanced Sound Source Localization Through Audio-Visual Alignment
item.description: Second, we introduce new evaluation metrics to rigorously assess sound source localization methods, focusing on accurately evaluating both localization performance and cross-modal interaction ability.

item.title: Using LLMs to Investigate Correlations of Conversational Follow-up Queries with User Satisfaction
item.description: From qualitative analysis of 250 conversational turns from an in-lab user evaluation of Naver Cue:, a commercial conversational search engine, we propose a taxonomy of 18 users' follow-up query patterns from conversational search, comprising two major axes: (1) users' motivations behind continuing conversations (N = 7) and (2) actions of follow-up queries (N = 11).

item.title: DCNv3: Towards Next Generation Deep Cross Network for CTR Prediction
item.description: Deep & Cross Network and its derivative models have become an important paradigm in click-through rate (CTR) prediction due to their effective balance between computational cost and performance.

item.title: HPix: Generating Vector Maps from Satellite Images
item.description: Vector maps find widespread utility across diverse domains due to their capacity to not only store but also represent discrete data boundaries such as building footprints, disaster impact analysis, digitization, urban planning, location points, transport links, and more.

item.title: TXL-PBC: a freely accessible labeled peripheral blood cell dataset
item.description: Moreover, we used the YOLOv8n model to train these three datasets, the performance of the TXL-PBC dataset surpass the original two datasets.

item.title: Benchmark Agreement Testing Done Right: A Guide for LLM Benchmark Evaluation
item.description: Despite the crucial role of BAT for benchmark builders and consumers, there are no standardized procedures for such agreement testing.

item.title: Fixed and Adaptive Simultaneous Machine Translation Strategies Using Adapters
item.description: The wait-$k$ policy offers a solution by starting to translate after consuming $k$ words, where the choice of the number $k$ directly affects the latency and quality.

item.title: AlcLaM: Arabic Dialectal Language Model
item.description: Arabic-specific PLMs are trained predominantly on modern standard Arabic, which compromises their performance on regional dialects.

item.title: Generating 3D House Wireframes with Semantics
item.description: We present a new approach for generating 3D house wireframes with semantic enrichment using an autoregressive model.

item.title: Uncertainty Calibration with Energy Based Instance-wise Scaling in the Wild Dataset
item.description: In this paper, we investigate robust post-hoc uncertainty calibration methods for DNNs within the context of multi-class classification tasks.

item.title: MoME: Mixture of Multimodal Experts for Generalist Multimodal Large Language Models
item.description: In this paper, we propose a mixture of multimodal experts (MoME) to mitigate task interference and obtain a generalist MLLM.

item.title: HGL: Hierarchical Geometry Learning for Test-time Adaptation in 3D Point Cloud Segmentation
item.description: HGL comprises three complementary modules from local, global to temporal learning in a bottom-up manner. Technically, we first construct a local geometry learning module for pseudo-label generation.

item.title: A Novel Dependency Framework for Enhancing Discourse Data Analysis
item.description: By converting both PDTB and RST annotations for the same texts into dependencies, this study also applies ``dependency distance'' metrics to examine the correlation between RST dependencies and PDTB dependencies in English.

item.title: Case2Code: Learning Inductive Reasoning with Synthetic Data
item.description: In this paper, we hope to focus on evaluating and teaching LLMs to conduct inductive reasoning, that is, LLMs are supposed to infer underlying rules by observing examples or sequential transformations.

item.title: The Better Angels of Machine Personality: How Personality Relates to LLM Safety
item.description: In this paper, we discover that LLMs' personality traits are closely related to their safety abilities, i. e., toxicity, privacy, and fairness, based on the reliable MBTI-M scale.

item.title: Leveraging the Mahalanobis Distance to enhance Unsupervised Brain MRI Anomaly Detection
item.description: Unsupervised Anomaly Detection (UAD) methods rely on healthy data distributions to identify anomalies as outliers.

item.title: CoSIGN: Few-Step Guidance of ConSIstency Model to Solve General INverse Problems
item.description: Within comparable NFEs, our method achieves new state-of-the-art in diffusion-based inverse problem solving, showcasing the significant potential of employing prior-based inverse problem solvers for real-world applications.

item.title: Base Models for Parabolic Partial Differential Equations
item.description: It is often necessary to compute the solutions or a function of the solutions to a parametric PDE in multiple scenarios corresponding to different parameters of this PDE.

item.title: Privacy-Preserving Adaptive Re-Identification without Image Transfer
item.description: Re-Identification systems (Re-ID) are crucial for public safety but face the challenge of having to adapt to environments that differ from their training distribution.

item.title: Dirac--Bianconi Graph Neural Networks -- Enabling Non-Diffusive Long-Range Graph Predictions
item.description: The geometry of a graph is encoded in dynamical processes on the graph.

item.title: Global-Local Similarity for Efficient Fine-Grained Image Recognition with Vision Transformers
item.description: Fine-grained recognition involves the classification of images from subordinate macro-categories, and it is challenging due to small inter-class differences.

item.title: SlimFlow: Training Smaller One-Step Diffusion Models with Rectified Flow
item.description: The rectified flow framework trains one-step generative models using two operations, reflow and distillation.

item.title: ER-FSL: Experience Replay with Feature Subspace Learning for Online Continual Learning
item.description: Existing replay-based methods mitigate forgetting by replaying buffered samples from old data and learning current samples of new data.

item.title: Fast Context-Based Low-Light Image Enhancement via Neural Implicit Representations
item.description: Current deep learning-based low-light image enhancement methods often struggle with high-resolution images, and fail to meet the practical demands of visual perception across diverse and unseen scenarios.

item.title: Dual-level Adaptive Self-Labeling for Novel Class Discovery in Point Cloud Segmentation
item.description: We tackle the novel class discovery in point cloud segmentation, which discovers novel classes based on the semantic knowledge of seen classes.

item.title: AdaLog: Post-Training Quantization for Vision Transformers with Adaptive Logarithm Quantizer
item.description: To address these issues, we propose a novel non-uniform quantizer, dubbed the Adaptive Logarithm AdaLog (AdaLog) quantizer.

item.title: ActionSwitch: Class-agnostic Detection of Simultaneous Actions in Streaming Videos
item.description: Online Temporal Action Localization (On-TAL) is a critical task that aims to instantaneously identify action instances in untrimmed streaming videos as soon as an action concludes -- a major leap from frame-based Online Action Detection (OAD).

item.title: RBAD: A Dataset and Benchmark for Retinal Vessels Branching Angle Detection
item.description: Detecting retinal image analysis, particularly the geometrical features of branching points, plays an essential role in diagnosing eye diseases.

item.title: Rethinking the Architecture Design for Efficient Generic Event Boundary Detection
item.description: Generic event boundary detection (GEBD), inspired by human visual cognitive behaviors of consistently segmenting videos into meaningful temporal chunks, finds utility in various applications such as video editing and.

item.title: ProcTag: Process Tagging for Assessing the Efficacy of Document Instruction Data
item.description: An effective evaluation method for document instruction data is crucial in constructing instruction data with high efficacy, which, in turn, facilitates the training of LLMs and MLLMs for document VQA.

item.title: NavGPT-2: Unleashing Navigational Reasoning Capability for Large Vision-Language Models
item.description: Capitalizing on the remarkable advancements in Large Language Models (LLMs), there is a burgeoning initiative to harness LLMs for instruction following robotic navigation.

item.title: Individualized Federated Learning for Traffic Prediction with Error Driven Aggregation
item.description: Low-latency traffic prediction is vital for smart city traffic management.

item.title: AgentPoison: Red-teaming LLM Agents via Poisoning Memory or Knowledge Bases
item.description: In particular, we form the trigger generation process as a constrained optimization to optimize backdoor triggers by mapping the triggered instances to a unique embedding space, so as to ensure that whenever a user instruction contains the optimized backdoor trigger, the malicious demonstrations are retrieved from the poisoned memory or knowledge base with high probability.

item.title: GeneralAD: Anomaly Detection Across Domains by Attending to Distorted Features
item.description: These features are fed to an attention-based discriminator, which is trained to score every patch in the image.

item.title: E5-V: Universal Embeddings with Multimodal Large Language Models
item.description: We propose a single modality training approach for E5-V, where the model is trained exclusively on text pairs.

item.title: VCP-CLIP: A visual context prompting model for zero-shot anomaly segmentation
item.description: In this end, we propose a visual context prompting model (VCP-CLIP) for ZSAS task based on CLIP.

item.title: SG-NeRF: Neural Surface Reconstruction with Scene Graph Optimization
item.description: To tackle this challenge, we present a novel approach that optimizes radiance fields with scene graphs to mitigate the influence of outlier poses.

item.title: Benchmarking Robust Self-Supervised Learning Across Diverse Downstream Tasks
item.description: Large-scale vision models have become integral in many applications due to their unprecedented performance and versatility across downstream tasks.

item.title: PersLLM: A Personified Training Approach for Large Language Models
item.description: Large language models exhibit aspects of human-level intelligence that catalyze their application as human-like agents in domains such as social simulations, human-machine interactions, and collaborative multi-agent systems.

item.title: EmoFace: Audio-driven Emotional 3D Face Animation
item.description: Our approach can generate facial expressions with multiple emotions, and has the ability to generate random yet natural blinks and eye movements, while maintaining accurate lip synchronization.

item.title: Enhancing Wrist Abnormality Detection with YOLO: Analysis of State-of-the-art Single-stage Detection Models
item.description: Diagnosing and treating abnormalities in the wrist, specifically distal radius, and ulna fractures, is a crucial concern among children, adolescents, and young adults, with a higher incidence rate during puberty.

item.title: Energy-Guided Diffusion Sampling for Offline-to-Online Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Combining offline and online reinforcement learning (RL) techniques is indeed crucial for achieving efficient and safe learning where data acquisition is expensive.
